title: Lucinda & Millie 2016 Made with Organic Grapes Cabernet Sauvignon (Mendocino County)
description: This is a basic, sturdy wine, medium to full bodied, smelling meaty and herbal, and tasting like blackberries. It has good heft on the palate due to moderate tannins.

title: Reif Estate 2016 Merlot (Niagara Peninsula)
description: A touch of residual sweetness can't mask the thinness of the fruit—this simply hasn't ripened sufficiently in this location. Flavors revolve around stem, thin berry, vanilla and green tannins.

title: Ressò 2016 Old Vines Garnacha (Catalunya)
description: Grapy wild-berry aromas show notes of raisin and wet clay. This feels full and blocky due to low acidity. A mix of candied plum, berry and green herb flavors are short on the finish.

title: Santa Julia 2017 Organic Chardonnay (Mendoza)
description: Peach and carrot-juice aromas are basic, as is the palate, which is acidic and punchy. Apple and stone-fruit flavors are inexact, while this wine is simple at best on a plump but slightly bitter-tasting finish.

title: Château les Maurinières 2014  Castillon Côtes de Bordeaux
description: Made without any wood aging, this wine is all about bright cherry fruit. It shows some stalkiness from the fruit along with plenty of juicy acidity, soft tannins and an easy, open character. Drink now.

title: Domaine Bousquet 2017 Gaia Made With Organic Grapes White (Tupungato)
description: Aromas of lime and generic greenness include hints of vanilla and yeast. This blend of Chardonnay, Pinot Gris and Sauvignon Blanc is citric and cutting in feel. Briny, somewhat sour flavors of green fruits end with tart, salty green-apple notes.

title: Cave Robert & Marcel NV La Petite Marquise Brut Rosé Sparkling (Crémant de Loire)
description: This soft, lightly fruity wine has attractive strawberry flavors. It is bright, with a crisp, yeasty aftertaste. Drink now.

title: Cerulean 2013 Sangiovese (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: Lighter in color, aromas of spice and cherry lead to lightly styled fruit flavors. It all seems a bit faint.

title: Adrás 2016 Mencía (Ribeira Sacra)
description: A heavily oaked nose smells more of milk chocolate and vanilla than natural fruit. On the palate, this is sticky and heavy. Flavors of cocoa and plum are more oak-based than authentic, and it doesn't let go of that dominant oak character on the finish.

title: Aniello 2017 006 Riverside Estate Chardonnay (Río Negro Valley)
description: The burnished gold color is almost tan, while this Patagonian Chardonnay smells of stone fruits along with the bitter pits. A full, pulpy palate offers salty citrus and stone-fruit flavors. It feels a bit oily on the finish.

title: Basel Cellars 2015 Carmenère (Columbia Valley (WA))
description: The aromas are a bit off-putting out of the gate, showing notes of tire rubber, with vanilla, herb, green pepper and cayenne. The palate is lighter in style, with soft fruit, herbs and plenty of barrel accents.

title: Bodega Toneles 2016 Tonel 14 Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Earthy berry aromas are candied and show a note of animal hide. This Malbec is snappy and lean in body. Briny, leathery plum flavors work hard to stay in form on the finish.

title: Cave Cooperative du Vendômois 2016 Le Cocagne Rosé (Coteaux du Vendômois)
description: Made from 100% Pineau d'Aunis, this light, fruity and gentle rosé comes from a region west of Orléans and north of the Loire. It produces crisp, cool wines, like this attractive raspberry-flavored bottling. It is ready to drink.

title: Cave des Producteurs de Vouvray 2015 La Javeline  (Vouvray)
description: This off-dry wine comes from vines growing on the plateau above Vouvray. A ripe wine, it's full of yellow fruits with a honeyed edge. Floral and lifted by crisp lemon acidity, the wine is ready to drink.

title: Chakana 2016 Maipe Malbec (Mendoza)
description: Stable plum and berry aromas are a bit spicy. This wine feels wiry, snappy and generic. Lightly herbal plum and berry aromas don't have much to say, and it tastes briny on the finish.

title: Fabre Montmayou 2015 Barrel Selection Cabernet Sauvignon (Patagonia)
description: Spicy, grassy aromas of clover, mint and red currant correctly introduce a tough-as-nails, dry-as-a-bone Cab. Minty red-berry flavors turn more leafy on a tannic palate that verges on abrasive.

title: Koenig Vineyards 2014 Cabernet-Syrah
description: A blend of equal parts, high toned aromas of cinnamon, barrel spice, herb and plum are followed by rich cinnamon and black-fruit flavors on a full-bodied palate.

title: Williamson Vineyard 2016 Blossom Sangiovese Rosé
description: Pale salmon in color, the aromas bring bright notes of watermelon and strawberry bubble gum. The flavors are broad and fat in feel, not coming together.

title: Château des Templiers 2015 Sur Lie  (Muscadet Sèvre et Maine)
description: A fruity wine, this has attractive citrus and sliced-pear flavors along with refreshing acidity. It is a light, bright wine, crisp and ready to drink.

title: Bodegas Corral 2015 Don Jacobo Vino Ecológico  (Rioja)
description: Spicy cinnamon and berry aromas are warm and cheesy. A jammy mouthfeel is lacking in structure, despite hard tannins. Flavors of raspberry jam include green notes of herbs and grass, while this feels flush on the finish, with clamping tannins.

title: Cave des Producteurs de Vouvray 2016 Les Chancelières  (Vouvray)
description: This is a soft, off-dry wine. White and yellow fruits are perfumed and crisp with acidity. Hints of almonds and toast go with the gentle texture. Drink now.

title: Château de Cappes 2015  Bordeaux
description: This is an earthy, rustic wine with simple black fruits and acidity. Developing fast, it is ready to drink with its berry flavors, soft tannins and crisp aftertaste.

title: Luc Pirlet 2016 Classique Pinot Noir (Pays d'Oc)
description: Faint hints of talc and carnation sit atop the fruity tones of strawberry and cranberry on the nose and mouth of this wine. It's light and easy in nature, with low tannins and a quick close. Drink now.

title: Monsieur de Bordeaux 2015 Merlot-Cabernet  (Bordeaux)
description: A smooth, spice and red-berry flavored wine, this is soft, with an almost sweet aftertaste. It is light, fruity and ready to drink.

title: Montebuena 2015 Cuvée KPF  (Rioja)
description: Punchy cherry and berry aromas are wiry. This wine is acidic and raw in feel, with tart flavors of pie cherry and plum. An angular finish is driven mostly by sharp acidity.

title: Ste. Chapelle 2015 Panoramic Idaho Petite Sirah
description: Unsettled aromas of plum, smoke, hot pepper and green wood lead to a light-bodied, smoky palate backed by firm, gritty tannins. It doesn't all come together.

title: Three Thieves 2016 Cabernet Sauvignon (California)
description: This wine tastes fresh and grapey and has a grippy tannic texture. A wallop of deep black-fruit flavors comes off as a little bit green and tight but at this price who is complaining?

title: Bodegas San Valero 2016 Particular Chardonnay (Cariñena)
description: Melon and citrus-peel aromas are basic. This wine is plump on the palate, with modest acidity. Pithy grapefruit and orange flavors are lasting on a finish with citrus-peel notes.

title: Bodegas Tobía 2016 Viña Tobía  (Rioja)
description: Medicinal, rubbery berry aromas are grapy and suggest latex. While big and round in feel, the palate lacks focus in its berry and plum flavors.

title: Colter's Creek 2015 Riesling (Lewis-Clark Valley (ID))
description: This wine shows some reduction out of the gate, along with aromas of flower, sweet herb and lime. The palate drinks dry and is lightly spritzy, with light-bodied fruit flavors.
